metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8624 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
curl before version 7.51.0 doesn't parse the authority component of the URLcorrectly when the host name part ends with a '#' character, and couldinstead be tricked into connecting to a different host. This may havesecurity implications if you for example use an URL parser that follows theRFC to check for allowed domains before using curl to request them.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2').
